articles.title: Cumhurbaşkanı Erdoğan: Türkiye gıptayla takip ediliyor
articles.title_tr: Cumhurbaşkanı Erdoğan: Türkiye gıptayla takip ediliyor
articles.summary: Cumhurbaşkanı Erdoğan, Beştepe'de öğrenciler, sporcular ve gençlerle iftar yaptı. Erdoğan açıklamalarda bulunuyor. "Ülkemizde tarihi bir dönüşüm yaşıyoruz" diyen Erdoğan, “Türkiye son yıllarda pek çok ülkenin gıpta ile takip ettiği büyük bir atılım gerçekleştiriyoruz." ifadelerini kullandı.

articles.title: Teknoloji Sektörü Geleneksel SDN İftarında Buluştu! 500 Kişilik SDN İftarı
articles.title_tr: Teknoloji Sektörü Geleneksel SDN İftarında Buluştu! 500 Kişilik SDN İftarı
articles.summary: Teknoloji ekosistemi, geleneksel hale gelen 15. SDN İftarında bir araya geldi. Her yıl büyüyerek devam eden ve artık sektörün en önemli buluşmalarından biri haline gelen ShiftDelete.Net iftar organizasyonunda bu yıl yaklaşık 500 değerli konuğumuzu ağırladık. Kamu temsilcileri, teknoloji şirketlerinin üst düzey yöneticileri, marka liderleri, basın mensupları, ajans başkanları, influencer’lar ve içerik üreticileri aynı sofrada buluştu. […]

articles.title: Pokemon Fans Are Connecting Gen-10 Dots Ahead Of Tomorrow’s Pokemon Day Livestream
articles.title_tr: Pokemon Fans Are Connecting Gen-10 Dots Ahead Of Tomorrow’s Pokemon Day Livestream
articles.summary: There's a sense of excitement in the air ahead of tomorrow's Pokemon Day livestream, with speculation that the showcase will give us our first look at Pokemon Gen 10. While nothing has been confirmed by Nintendo, The Pokemon Company, or Game Freak, the mood in the room is positive, and people are reading the Sinistea leaves, claiming that all signs point toward a big reveal on February 27. Is there some truth to this, or is it wishful thinking? Let's break it down.It has been four years since a new Pokemon generation debutedSince 2010, new Pokemon generations have debuted every three years, but that pattern ended after the release of Pokemon Scarlet and Violet in 2022. That wait between new mainline entries has been filled by a variety of Pokemon projects, including expansions for Scarlet and Violet, remakes of the Diamond and Pearl games, multiple mobile titles, and last year's Pokemon Legends: Z-A, which shifted the series away from turn-based battling and toward real-time action. To put it simply, everyone involved in Pokemon has been busy, but there might be a very good reason why it has taken a little longer for a new Pokemon generation to debut.2026 is the perfect year for Pokemon Gen 10 Continue Reading at GameSpot

articles.title: Who is Zeno in Resident Evil Requiem?
articles.title_tr: Who is Zeno in Resident Evil Requiem?
articles.summary: Okay, you're probably wondering if Zeno is Wesker, right? This antagonist makes his debut in Resident Evil Requiem and his resemblance to the ol' "big bad" of the series is quite uncanny. We're here you answer your questions and posit some of our own theories. Sit back, relax, and be ready for a few spoilers, too.Table of Contents [hide]Resident Evil Requiem: Is Zeno a Wannabe Wesker?Resident Evil Requiem: Is Zeno a Wannabe Wesker?Zeno in Resident Evil Requiem has a physical appearance that greatly resembles Albert Wesker's, from the slicked back hairstyle to the cool sunglasses/shades. Although Wesker primarily wore black or dark-colored clothing, Zeno prefers a white three-piece suit underneath his black coat. In spite of this difference, he still has that head-turning drip.Zeno's abilities are similar to Wesker's as well, given that he can move at blindingly fast speeds, to the point of being able to dodge bullets. Both also prefer using handguns to eliminate their opponents.Continue Reading at GameSpot

articles.summary: Yapay zeka dünyasındaki rekabet her geçen gün yeni bir boyut kazanırken, Google görüntü üretim teknolojilerinde kartları yeniden dağıtıyor. Teknoloji devinin görüntü oluşturma odaklı “Nano Banana” serisi, geçtiğimiz yılın Ağustos ayında viral bir fenomene dönüşmüş, Kasım ayında ise “Pro” versiyonuyla stüdyo kalitesinde yaratıcılığı kullanıcılara sunmuştu. articles.title: Rusya ve Fransa büyükelçilikleri sosyal medyada birbirlerini hedef aldı

articles.title: Nintendo Already Made A Subtle Switch 2 Price Hike, Expert Says
articles.title_tr: Nintendo Already Made A Subtle Switch 2 Price Hike, Expert Says
articles.summary: Nintendo's discontinuation of the $500 Nintendo Switch 2 bundle with Mario Kart World is akin to a price hike, according to expert video game industry consultant Matthew Ball.Speaking to The Game Business following the release of his "The State of Video Gaming in 2026" report, the conversation drifted toward the DRAM crisis the video game industry currently faces and all of the price hikes that have been happening as a result. Ball argued that while the base price of Switch 2 hasn't gone up yet, the discontinuation of the Mario Kart World bundle is essentially a price increase for most people."Nintendo terminated the Switch 2 bundle with Mario Kart after three to four months," Ball said, "That’s really early. And I suspected it is primarily a DRAM thing. It’s $449 for the Switch 2. It’s $80 for Mario Kart. That’s $530 all in. [Nintendo] sells them for $500 as a combined unit, but if they depreciate that unit so that it’s $450, and if you want Mario Kart, you now have to spend $80."Continue Reading at GameSpot

Ball argued that while the base price of Switch 2 hasn't gone up yet, the discontinuation of the Mario Kart World bundle is essentially a price increase for most people."Nintendo terminated the Switch 2 bundle with Mario Kart after three to four months," Ball said, "That’s really early. And I suspected it is primarily a DRAM thing. It’s $449 for the Switch 2. It’s $80 for Mario Kart. That’s $530 all in. [Nintendo] sells them for $500 as a combined unit, but if they depreciate that unit so that it’s $450, and if you want Mario Kart, you now have to spend $80."Continue Reading at GameSpot

Ball argued that while the base price of Switch 2 hasn't gone up

articles.title: Pause-Screen Ads May Be The Future For PC And Console, Says Expert
articles.title_tr: Pause-Screen Ads May Be The Future For PC And Console, Says Expert
articles.summary: Mobile gamers already have to put up with numerous ads when trying to play on the go, but they may have to deal with the same issue in the future with console and PC games. Video game analyst Matthew Ball has published his State of Video Gaming report, and one of his predictions is that ads will be coming to pause and loading screens for players at home, whether they like it or not.While speaking with The Game Business, Ball noted that advertisements are already littered in mobile phone apps and streaming services like Hulu, Peacock, and Netflix. He believes that the major video game publishers will soon adopt the same strategy in part because an additional revenue stream may help keep prices down."The more important thing is the economic reality," said Ball. "If we say that audiences in the eight major markets [US, UK, Germany, Japan, Korea, Canada, Italy, and France], which are 60% of all PC console sales globally, are not spending more, the costs are going up. We don't want layoffs, we don't want fewer games, we don't just want the same games … We don't want price increases. The money needs to come in one way or another."Continue Reading at GameSpot
articles.summary_tr: Mobile gamers already have to put up with numerous ads when trying to play on the go, but they may have to deal with the same issue in the future with console and PC games. Video game analyst Matthew Ball has published his State of Video Gaming report, and one of his predictions is that ads will be coming to pause and loading screens for players at home, whether they like it or not.While speaking with The Game Business, Ball noted that advertisements are already littered in mobile phone apps and streaming services like Hulu, Peacock, and Netflix. He believes that the major video game publishers will soon adopt the same strategy in part because an additional revenue stream may help keep prices down."The more important thing is the economic reality," said Ball. "If we say that audiences in the eight major markets [US, UK, Germany, Japan, Korea, Canada, Italy, and France], which are 60% of all PC console sales globally, are not spending more, the costs are going up. We don't want layoffs, we don't want fewer games, we don't just want the same games … We don't want price increases. The money needs to come in one way or another."Continue Reading at GameSpot

articles.title: WoW: Midnight Might Quietly Be Its Most Transformative Expansion Since Cataclysm
articles.title_tr: WoW: Midnight Might Quietly Be Its Most Transformative Expansion Since Cataclysm
articles.summary: If you had said a year ago that World of Warcraft's Midnight expansion would be its most transformative since 2010's Cataclysm, few would have taken you seriously. Nevertheless, there is an argument to be made that Midnight has already brought more foundational changes to Blizzard's 22-year-old MMORPG in the last few months than in the entire six-year period between Legion and Dragonflight. And it's not even fully out yet.It's a more subtle transformation to be sure. Whereas Cataclysm overhauled all of Azeroth in an impossible-not-to-notice planet-wide catastrophe, Midnight is instead overhauling the game's underlying fundamentals in a number of ways that may not be all that visible to those on the outside.Many of those major changes are live right now, ahead of the expansion proper. Housing, a feature players have been daydreaming about for almost as long as WoW has existed, went live in December for those who preordered Midnight. Housing is one of the biggest additions to WoW in its history, a new pillar of the game going forward that will grow and expand over time. But that's just part of WoW's Midnight metamorphosis.Continue Reading at GameSpot

And it's not even fully out yet.It's a more subtle transformation to be sure. Whereas Cataclysm
articles.long_summary_tr: If you had said a year ago that World of Warcraft's Midnight expansion would be its most transformative since 2010's Cataclysm, few would have taken you seriously. Nevertheless, there is an argument to be made that Midnight has already brought more foundational changes to Blizzard's 22-year-old MMORPG in the last few months than in the entire six-year period between Legion and Dragonflight. And it's not even fully out yet.It's a more subtle transformation to be sure. Whereas Cataclysm

articles.title: Apollo rocks reveal the Moon had brief bursts of super-strong magnetism
articles.title_tr: Apollo rocks reveal the Moon had brief bursts of super-strong magnetism
articles.summary: Scientists at the University of Oxford have finally settled a decades-long mystery about the Moon’s magnetic field — and it turns out both sides were right. By reanalyzing Apollo mission rocks, they discovered that the Moon did occasionally generate an incredibly powerful magnetic field, even stronger than Earth’s — but only for fleeting bursts lasting thousands of years or less. Most of the time, the Moon’s magnetic field was weak.

articles.title: DTF St. Louis Review
articles.title_tr: DTF St. Louis Review
articles.summary: DTF St. Louis review: The new HBO show starring David Harbour, Jason Bateman, and Linda Cardellini won’t be for everyone, but if you enjoy shows like FX’s Fargo and HBO’s own The Chair Company, it’s worth getting down with DTF.
